body.name: Zalman CNPS9X Performa ARGB CPU Air Cooler Fan - 5V 3-Pin Connector - 180W TDP - 120mm Fan - 4 Direct Touch Heatpipes (DTH) - for Intel LGA1700/1200/1151 - AMD Ryzen AM5/AM4, Black
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Saturday, February 17 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Tomorrow, February 13. Order within 6 hrs 5 mins
features: Unmatched Cooling Performance: The CNPX 9X Performa boasts an innovative and highly efficient cooling design, ensuring your CPU stays at the ideal temperature even under heavy loads.
Enhanced Stability with Anti-Vibration Damper: Equipped with an advanced anti-vibration damper, the CNPX 9X Performa ensures silent and stable operation, minimizing any unwanted noise.

Mesmerizing RGB Lighting: Add a touch of style to your PC build with the mesmerizing RGB lighting featured on the CNPX 9X Performa. The stunning RGB illumination not only enhances the cooler's aesthetics but also adds an impressive visual dimension to your gaming rig.

Optimized PWM Control: Enjoy total control over your CPU cooling performance with the CNPX 9X Performa's optimized PWM control. Tailor the fan speed precisely to your needs, strike the perfect balance between performance and noise, and maintain your system's coolness without any hassle.

Universal Compatibility: The Zalman CNPX 9X Performa is fully compatible with the latest processors from both Intel and AMD, ensuring a seamless and hassle-free installation process for a wide range of systems.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Enhanced Stability with Anti-Vibration Damper Equipped with an advanced anti-vibration damper, the CNPX 9X Performa ensures silent and stable operation, minimizing any unwanted noise. Optimized PWM Control Enjoy total control over your CPU cooling performance with the CNPX 9X Performa's optimized PWM control. Tailor the fan speed precisely to your needs, strike the perfect balance between performance and noise, and maintain your system's coolness without any hassle. Direct Touch Heat Pipes (DTH) Heat pipes directly facilitate heat transfer, optimizing cooling performance and minimizing heat resistance.

Specifications Model CNPS9X PERFORMA ARGB BLACK Dimensions 4.80 x 3 x 6.18(H) In Materials Pure Copper, Pure Aluminum Weight 1.5 lb Fan Dimensions 120 mm Fan Bearing Type Hydro Bearing Fan Speed 700~1,800RPM±10% Max. Fan Noise Level 28dB(A)±10% Fan Connector Type 4-Pin Socket Compatibility Intel Socket : LGA1700/1200/115X and AMD Socket : AM5/AM4

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2023
reviews.reviewText: It came with everything needed for proper assembly. It's a definite improvement over stock cooler.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good heat sync, ok fan.
reviews.reviewText: It did a really good job at keeping my 9700k cool. I was even able to overclock it a little bit. I know these less companies use good heat syncs, but cheaper and less reliable fans. I’ve been using it for a couple months now and the fan is still running smooth and quiet.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great cooler with Potential and a defect
reviews.reviewText: I would like to start this review by saying that this is the first non Vine free product review for this product.I run a side business selling custom built pcs and I have a lot of experience with different coolers. I picked up this cooler due to its full black design (I was doing a blackout build) and it’s price. I have to say, with only 4 heat pipes, it outperforms the competition’s 5 heat pipe design (let’s call them TR). The temperature are substantially lower (8 degrees) on this cooler than the 5 heatpipe on the TR on full load.The fan is whisper quite. The only reason I took a star off is the rgb leds on the fan. They do not match the other case fans in the case. It’s always darker than the rest. It’s really annoying. Shown in picture.Overall this product has great potential if they could fix the fan rgb and provide the cooler in white.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Colorful and moves air
reviews.reviewText: This is a great looking and inexpensive cooler that works well. Easy to install and would do a great job for most builds. The fans are quite and run at the same noise level as my case fans. The mounting points for LGA1700 sockets are correct.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Temperatures line up with other 120mm towers for a 105W load
reviews.reviewText: I've tried a few 120mm 4- and 5-heatpipe towers on the same CPU, and this one performs similarly on a 105W (as reported in software) 6600K at 4.4GHz and 1.330V (it is stable a 1.290V which reduces power by 5W and 5C reported, but I used the higher voltage to make more heat for testing). Value at the time of ordering will likely play a large part in choosing a heatsink, as there are many similar options in this bracket. The fan at full speed gets a little loud, though keeps the 6600K at about 54C above ambient, except for one core at 50C above. I suspect that core has better contact under the IHS, as that difference persists across multiple mounts and heatsinks. The mounting hardware isn't great, but it isn't bad. The backplate is keyed for the different pin spacings, but the mounting ring on the CPU side just has elongated cutouts so doesn't naturally center itself. That leaves some play when tightening it down on the pins which could impact performance as it moves the centerline and the heatpipe location relative to the core. Probably not a real issue, but it does make assembly feel a little less nice.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Cool and also cool.
reviews.reviewText: The Zalman CNPS9X Performa ARGB CPU Air Cooler is like the superhero of CPU coolers. It’s not just a cooler, it’s a chiller. With its 3-Pin Connector, it plugs into your motherboard like a charm, ready to take on the heat.The 180W TDP is no joke. It’s like having a mini air conditioner for your CPU. The 120mm fan is the perfect size - not too big to hog space, but not too small to compromise on performance.The 4 Direct Touch Heatpipes (DTH) are the secret agents in this operation. They’re on a mission to transfer heat away from your CPU faster than you can say “overclocking”. And they do it with style, all while being whisper quiet.Compatibility? No worries there. Whether you’re team Intel or team AMD, this cooler has got you covered. It’s like the Switzerland of CPU coolers - neutral and friendly with everyone.The black color gives it a sleek and stealthy look. It’s like the Batman of CPU coolers - always there, always vigilant, but never drawing attention to itself.In conclusion, if you want a cooler that’s high on performance, low on noise, and big on compatibility, the Zalman CNPS9X Performa ARGB CPU Air Cooler is your go-to guy. Or should I say, go-to fan?

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Works as expected. Great buy for the money.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars For the price when it's discounted, it checks a lot of boxes
reviews.reviewText: Disclaimer, when I first tested this cooler, the price was $20. Now that it's $35, which is the same price as the Thermalright Peerless Assassin, and makes this Zalman CNPS9X a bit of a tough sell.Now that's out of the way, I tested this with a Ryzen 5 7600 non-X at stock power settings (no PBO) and "standard" fan curve on a Gigabyte B650 Aorus Elite AX, 32GB of Crucial DDR5 at EXPO 1 speeds w/ Arctic MX-6 thermal paste (this is for consistency, I usually don't test w/ the included thermal paste since the cooler might be good but the included paste could be bad). CPU temps maxed out at 83.4C with a reported max package power draw of 78.4W. My room was being heated at the moment so ambient was around 73F for reference. This performance is decent for an entry-level processor, although it might struggle on an i7/Ryzen 7.The mounting system was pretty easy to work with, it uses a giant metal bracket instead of 2 separate pieces that the cooler screws onto. Interesting, if you leave the ARGB pin unplugged, it defaults to rainbow color instead of the RGB being completely turned off. This is something to note if you're trying to use this fan for a non-RGB build.Overall, the CNPS9X's price holds it back when it's not on sale. If you need performance, the Thermalright Peerless Assassin is the same price and is one of the best performing CPU coolers on the market. There's nothing inherently bad about this thing though, but definitely keep an eye on the price; if you need ARGB there's options that are <$20, and if you need performance, there's definitely options too. Overall, this is definitely a "if the price is right" product. It doesn't do anything bad, but you shouldn't pair this with a really power-hungry processor, and definitely watch the price.
